title: `spack module lmod loads` should load hierarchy prerequisites
body:
`spack module lmod loads` should output commands to load hierarchical prerequisites.

### Rationale
Currently, `spack module lmod loads` (and relatives such as `spack env loads -m lmod`) output only the spec specified. If this isn't in the Core part of the Lmod hierarchy, it is not possible to directly load the module; it can only be loaded _after_ its hierarchical prerequisites.

The `-r/--dependencies` flag helps this situation somewhat, but doesn't properly load dependent compilers for a hierarchy. My understanding is that _eventually_ compilers will become "true" dependencies, at which point this will change—but we aren't there yet. In any case, it may not be wanted to load _all_ dependencies, only those needed to actually load the module.


### Description
As an example of the desired behavior, given I have an installed spec `hdf5 ^openmpi %aocc`:
```console
$ spack module lmod loads hdf5 ^openmpi %aocc
# aocc@3.0.0%gcc@8.3.1 +license-agreed arch=linux-centos8-zen2
module load aocc/3.0.0-abcdefg
# openmpi@4.0.5%aocc@3.0.0 ~atomics~cuda~cxx~cxx_exceptions+gpfs~internal-hwloc~java~legacylaunchers~lustre~memchecker~pmi~singularity~sqlite3+static~thread_multiple+vt+wrapper-rpath fabrics=none patches=60ce20bc14d98c572ef7883b9fcd254c3f232c2f3a13377480f96466169ac4c8 schedulers=none arch=linux-centos8-zen2
module loads openmpi/4.05-hijklmn
# hdf5@1.10.7%aocc@3.0.0 ~cxx~debug~fortran~hl~java+mpi+pic+shared~szip~threadsafe api=none arch=linux-centos8-zen2
module loads hdf5/1.10.7-opqrstu
```

Of course, any spec installed with a Core compiler or listed under Core specs need not load the relevant hierarchical prerequisites. (I.e. compiler for the former, any for the latter.)


### Additional information
Spack version: 0.16.1-2445-5e8b8b883c


### General information

- [x] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [x] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
